member.name: T:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueue`1
member.summary: An implementation of a min-Priority Queue using a heap. Has O(1) .Contains()! See https://bitbucket.org/BlueRaja/high-speed-priority-queue-for-c/wiki/Getting%20Started for more information
member.typeparam: The values in the queue. Must implement the PriorityQueueNode interface

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueue`1.First
member.summary: Gets the head of the queue, without removing it (use Dequeue() for that). O(1)
member.value: Returns the head of the queue, without removing it (use Dequeue() for that). O(1)

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueue`1.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The max nodes ever allowed to be enqueued (going over this will cause an exception)

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueue`1.Dequeue
member.summary: Removes the head of the queue (node with highest priority; ties are broken by order of insertion), and returns it. O(log n)

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueue`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes a node from the queue. Note that the node does not need to be the head of the queue. O(log n)

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueue`1.Contains(`0)
member.returns: True if contains the node, false in other case

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueue`1.HasHigherPriority(`0,`0)
member.summary: Returns true if 'higher' has higher priority than 'lower', false otherwise. Note that calling HasHigherPriority(node, node) (ie. both arguments the same node) will return false
member.returns: True if t has higher priority than lower

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueueNode.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the Priority to insert this node at. Must be set BEFORE adding a node to the queue.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueueNode.InsertionIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the order the node was inserted in Used by the priority queue - do not edit this value.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Common.Helpers.PriorityQueueNode.QueueIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the current position in the queue Used by the priority queue - do not edit this value.

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Math.BoundingOrientedBox.ContainsRelativeBox(WaveEngine.Common.Math.Vector3@,WaveEngine.Common.Math.Vector3@,WaveEngine.Common.Math.Matrix@)
member.summary: Determine whether the box described by half-extents hA, axis-aligned and centered at the origin, contains the box described by half-extents hB, whose position and orientation are given by the transform matrix mB. The matrix is assumed to contain only rigid motion; if it contains scaling or perpsective the result of this method will be incorrect.
member.param: Position and orientation of second box relative to first box
member.returns: ContainmentType enum indicating whether the boxes are disjoin, intersecting, or whether box A contains box B.

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Math.BoundingOrientedBox.ConvertToFrustum
member.summary: Convert this BoundingOrientedBox to a BoundingFrustum describing the same volume. A BoundingFrustum is defined by the matrix that carries its volume to the box from (-1,-1,0) to (1,1,1), so we just need a matrix that carries our box there.

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Math.MathHelper.Barycentric(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the Cartesian coordinate for one axis of a point that is defined by a given triangle and two normalized barycentric (areal) coordinates.
member.param: The coordinate on one axis of vertex 1 of the defining triangle.
The coordinate on the same axis of vertex 2 of the defining triangle.
The coordinate on the same axis of vertex 3 of the defining triangle.
The normalized barycentric (areal) coordinate b2, equal to the weighting factor for vertex 2, the coordinate of which is specified in value2.
The normalized barycentric (areal) coordinate b3, equal to the weighting factor for vertex 3, the coordinate of which is specified in value3.
member.returns: Cartesian coordinate of the specified point with respect to the axis being used.

member.summary: Linearly interpolates between value1 and value2 by amount. The parameter amount is not clamped and values outside the range [0, 1] will result in a return value outside the range [value1, value2]. Returns a positive number if c is to the left of the line going from a to b.
